info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 10:23AM CDT until August 12 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee/Sullivan WI
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin...
Fox River Lower At Waukesha affecting Waukesha County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Fox River Lower at Waukesha.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water hits the base of Barstow St bridge and Bank St bridge. Corrina Blvd, Buckley St, Baxter St, W Main St is flooded. Water impacts Bank St and E St Paul Ave. Frame Park is flooded. There is widespread flooding around homes in the Bethesda Court area about one half mile south of downtown Waukesha.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Sunday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 06/09/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
